net.sf.jclec.problem.classification.fuzzyrule

Class FuzzyRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclec.exprtree.fun.ExprTreeFunction
      • net.sf.jclec.problem.classification.base.Rule
        • net.sf.jclec.problem.classification.fuzzyrule.FuzzyRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, net.sf.jclec.exprtree.IContext, net.sf.jclec.JCLEC, IClassifier

    public class FuzzyRule
extends Rule
    Implementation of a classification fuzzy rule.

    In fuzzy there is no crip classification yet a grade of certainty in which the rule covers an instance. This is based on the certainty of the membership functions on the given instance. Therefore, the classify() method returns a double value representing the degree in which the rule covers the instance.

    Author:
    Sebastian Ventura, Amelia Zafra, Jose M. Luna, Alberto Cano, Juan Luis Olmo
    See Also:
